Detailed Description

At the semantic level both this class and CArithExprTreeNode are the same, and can be used interchangably, the distinction comes when we reach the lower levels of representation in which this difference does become important. This why there are two separate classes for arithmetic and boolean expression tree nodes.

Children:
   0. LHS of the expression
   1. RHS of the expression.

Member Function Documentation

CTreeNode * CBooleanExprTreeNode::RewriteExprIntoArithmeticForm ( CTreeNode *  RhsNode,
CVarDeclTreeNode *  TempVar,
CTreeNode *  Stmts 
) [private]

Rewrite the Boolean expr into an arithmetic form if it's of logical type. Operations against true and false are replaced with the literal values 1 and 0 respectively.

Parameters:
RhsNode The simplified RHS of the original expression
TempVar The temporary variable which will hold the rewritten result of the expression.
Stmts Global MIR tree passed in the compiler driver.

bool CBooleanExprTreeNode::HasRelationalOperator ( void   )  [private]

Determine if we have a relational or logical operator.

Returns:
True if we have a relation operator, false if we have a logical one.

CTreeNode * CBooleanExprTreeNode::RewriteIntoMIRForm ( CTreeNode *  Stmts  )  [virtual]

For logical Boolean expressions, rewrite it into a series or arithmetic equivalents using the literal values 0 and 1 instead of "true" and "false". For relation expressions these transformations aren't applied, only the normal simplifications.

Implements CTreeNode.
